column6: Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision
column8: 'The tower bell rings 2 a clock. The low boom of the tram trembles the hot air. Crows chatter in the trees surrounding the park and masking the city's noise. After a cold spring, summer has finally arrived. Small children enjoy the cool water, and ice cream, in the first city park of Amsterdam. A nostalgic image of 'endless' vacations and hot summer days, recorded in the cool shadow of a music kiosk. Mid Side recording, resampled from 96K to 48K for upload. Some equalisation and fades.

The opening of the space mixes the close sounds (pedestrians, birds, dwellings, voices ...) and the sounds of circulation that come from the neighboring streets. Many Cantonese homes raise birds in their dwelling which is heard from the pedestrian crossing.

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Loading of minerals on the Charcoal dock recorded from the end of the pole BC. Various signals in the national basin (lapping, squeaks and crane motors, hammering, train convoys, indefinite signal with multiple echoes, car alarm, Klark startup, etc.). Background noise from the coastal highway. The respondent wants to invest such a site and take advantage of this "reserve" of port calm. When one abandons the aesthetic interpretation of the fragment. It evokes either a decadent traditional port (grinding cranes, lack of vitality). A science fiction port. New silent technologies. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Fishing scene on the Great Dyke (Quai Jean-Charcot). In front of hangars J2-J3 of the Joliette. On the background of auxiliary engines of a SNCM ferry. Hissing and communication on a (very) slow mode between three friendly fishermen. Sounds of reel and throw. Passage of a motorboat. Communication between fishermen is not "continuous chatter" (as in "Corniche"). It indicates the presence of highly concentrated "pros". Lonely. But never very far from their fellows. Installed at a point where the maritime sounds do not reach. Nor the urban sounds. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Before the departure of a ferry from the SNSM. Scene recorded on a dock between two hangars of the Joliette. Discussion sometimes intelligible from a group of port employees on the status of dockers facing open bunkers of the ship. Auxiliary motors and shocks in bunkers. Passage of a pilotine in the basin. Road traffic on the viaduct (coastal highway). The scene generally seems appalling of banality. It is ultimately deprived of any port or even Marseilles port significance. The bad image of the Marseilles dockers (at the time of the interviews) is clear. The listener feels totally excluded from the "very physical" world of dockworkers (author's abstract)

Telephone and radio exchanges between the person in charge of the position. The pilot of a freighter and the Captaincy. Passage and wake of the freighter. Then siren of the bridge of Arenc for the maneuver of downhill. Rumor of the port. Far away shocks and passage of an airplane. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Traveling on the pavement of the Quai des Belges. very lively. Sounds of pier. Then of fish market on a background of automobile traffic. Warning signals for the departure of the shuttle from the Frioul Islands. Music coming from a portable device. Appeals-gadgets (& quot; tarrailletes & quot;). Altercation between a fish merchant and a dissatisfied customer. Pas and laughter. We are in a typical place of encounter. Of ostentation and of "cinema" (that which the merchant does). The mixing of local populations and social classes. National and foreign. Makes this quay of the Belgians a cosmopolitan urban space of self-staging. Here one is more in the heart of the maritime city than in the port or the port city. Urban noise threatens vocal activity. even if. In the fragment. It appears less than in reality and fails to "cover the dispute". (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Repair of two ships. One afloat in the repair dock. The other in dry dock in form 10. Hammering. Continuous alarm of a moving crane. Reverberation caused by the empty form and the two shells facing each other. The hardness and quality of work produced by these isolated workers trigger the respectful admiration of the respondents. In a port that recently lost several ship repair companies that acoustically recalled the local economic health. The fragment emits impressions of gigantism and power (at the height of the dimensions of the form 10). But also of hostility and danger. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Loading of a container ship on the platform of the Mourrepiane terminal. Various horns and maneuvers of several forklifts under the crane. Grinding of brakes and dampers. Pneumatic cylinders. Metal shocks of containers. This recording evokes an industrial and modern framework of high technicality. Which manifests a high degree of "civilization". The activities there are intense and the dangers countless. The total absence of human sounds is deplored. Even if it is known that a few men are sufficient to animate this activity. The metallic sounds often make the listener of the port and maritime imagination pass to that of the railway. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Exactly under the sopraelevata. Between the piazza Caricamento and the entrance of the zone of Expò. Loud voices and laughter of teenagers playing football behind the grids. Passage of pedestrians with plastic bags. Clacking of the viaduct roadway joints. Rumor of the traffic and passage of an ambulance (or police). The respondents evoke the planned destruction of the sopraelevata. Even if they recognize its usefulness and the situation of belvedere on the city and the port that it offers to its user. The space perceived under the viaduct has no port identity. It is a simple place of transition. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Auction recorded in Roscoff at 6:00 (that of Brest did not yet work during the recording phase but was open during the phase where we conducted the interviews). Exchanges between the crier (amplified with the aid of a megaphone). Fishermen and fishmongers. Dissatisfaction of a fisherman ( "Eh. Brown!"). Case shocks and running water in the background. Listening to the fragment evokes the crisis in the world of fishermen (the interviews date back to March 1993) and that of more glorious periods when it was still possible to meet the "fishermen-beggars" in the city. Fishers are considered to be the holders and representatives of an endangered culture. Some try to explain the difficulties of expansion of the fishing and pleasure activities in Brest by the preponderance of the soldier. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: 12:00 on the pontoon with a textile blanket located at the end of the Spinola laying. Recently renamed via del Mare. In the area of ??Expò. Open to walkers during the day. Lapping. Creaking of the pontoon. Urban and port rumor. Bells coming from several churches of Porto vecchio. Mirror of a factory in Sampierdarena. Whistle of a ferry docked at Ponte Andrea Doria (one of the ferry terminals). Multiple echoes. This public sounding place is practiced by several listeners. They always find there the reserve of silence they need when they have selfish or mystical cravings for solitude. It may not offer this service for long if the Genoese invest it as much as the town planner predicted. At this distance. The visual and sound mask effect of the sopraelevata fades. And the sonorous fusion between the city and the port takes place. It is through listening to the least animated sequence that the essence is identified. The identity of the port or city-port. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Sirens of the Petit-Minou lighthouse recorded near the fort per day of fog. One hears at the bottom the surge of the waves on the point and some seagulls or gulls. As well as a regular signal (probably at the Mengant fort). The listeners spontaneously engage in a discourse of indifference or pride (resigned or obscurantist) about the clichés that associate Brittany. mist. The rain and the wind. The spectacle of the elements in bad weather has a high attractive potential and elevates the soul of who will appreciate it. The siren and the waves evoke either the dramatic expectation of the seaman's wife. The expectation of travel and adventure. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Scene of the gathering of sailing ships of Brest 92 (July 1992). Recorded at the Port Rhu of Douarnenez. Song to be hoisted sung by the crew of an old rig during the maneuver. Lapping. A spectator returns to the air. Comments and applause from the crowd. Second generation generator. Announcement of the organizers by the sound system. The "warmth of the voice" makes it possible to counterbalance the lack of warmth of the Brestois urban planning. The listeners show a sense of pride and cultural belonging to the "peoples of the sea". Fueled by the importance and rarity of the event. This is an opportunity to distinguish between northern and southern ports. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Scene of conviviality. Around 12:00. In one of the two large multipurpose rooms used by dockworkers for their meetings and leisure activities (close to the COOP). These halls were used for everyday hiring (chiamata a voce) until 1986. Shards of voice and verbal exchanges between dockers of all ages. The dockers. To the bad character ( "ronchonneurs"). But practicing "direct" language. Appear as survivors and loyal guarantors of republican principles. Whereas Italy sees its institutions under attack (at the time of the investigation). Listeners are sensitive to the difficulties of life of dockworkers and their families. As well as the archaism of the mode of hiring mentioned. Which has just disappeared. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Extremity of the moat of the 1st basin (rue Aldéric-Lecomte). Waves and gulls. Slamming of doors and passage of several vehicles and a moped. Voices and clinking of distant halyards. The two sirens of the Arsenal (that of the Pont de Recouvrance and the one situated more to the west under the road of the Corniche). This sequence seems to make postcard for Brest. She recalled the difficult working conditions for civilians in the Arsenal. As well as the break between the Brest civil and the Brest Military. Cut that does not appear as extreme on the,

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: From the metallic footbridge under the fishermen's quay of Dàrsena (fishing and repair port). Grinding of ropes. Cloche (civil) of the building that dominates the basin. Voices of fishermen on the upper dock. Drône of the traffic on the sopraelevata (road viaduct). Local and external hammerings. Remote hammer. Variation of timbre due to wind. The surveys. At the hearing of the bells. Tend to miniaturize space. They make it a village or a minimal port. Christian latinity and urban rumor are in schizophonic conflict. The outcome of the fight is uncertain. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Loading of potatoes on a wharf of the Eritrea. Recorded between refrigerated warehouses and a freighter. Shocks of wood (pallets) and metal. Forklift engines. Cranes and a conveyor belt. Crisis and verbal exchanges between dockworkers. This sequence is marked by its strong humanization. The respondents commented on the work of the dockers who were recognized by their accent and their "screams" in a context where verbal communication was difficult. They are the subject of a very "physical" description. Not always very flattering. Some traits of character are stigmatized. But their frankness is also admired. This sequence with the outdated aspect conceals a message of hope for the Genoese. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: On a dock of the 5th basin between the public fridges and the hull of a freighter. Loading of shacks of frozen meat quarters. Shocks of wood (pallets) and metal (chain and hook of the cranes). Fenwick and crane engines and horns. The dockers whistle and are questioned. Men are rare and isolated on the quays to carry out their dangerous work. They do not communicate or little. With no time (profitability). Nor the sound opportunity (no acoustic niche). (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Nocturnal rumor of the port and the city from the castle of Montjuïc. We hear on one side the rumbling of traffic on the cinturò del Litoral. And from the other distant squeaks. The warning of a crane. And industrial sounds located on the moll del Contradic. Light wind. The respondents have the impression of being in an inhospitable space. Completely devoid of familiar elements. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: The sequence. Very reverberated. Is also very spatial: the listener is surrounded by different sources in motion. Ball game and teenage screams in a narrow pedestrian street in the heart of Barceloneta. Passage of inhabitants of the neighborhood. One discovers some prosodic features of the sentences heard (in particular the Andalusian accent of the thwarted passerby to avoid the ball). Several birds in cage. Passage of light vehicles and motorcycles to the ends of the street. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Last working hour on the deck of a cargo ship docked at the dock of the 5th basin. Palletized loading of frozen meat quarters. Metal squeaks and clicks. Crane engines. Verbal exchanges between the & quot; panel & quot; (Deck man, with a slightly reverberated voice). The crane operator (in his cabin, mat) and the bilge man (very reverberated). The crane operator presses his colleagues. A regular siren is heard in the harbor. We are "at the dockers' and very close to them. Their work seems organized and effective. They fight the sounds of their activity by the cry. Although it is considered animated and rhythmic. The sequence is accused of masking reality: it conjugally evokes moments of non-activity of the port. Even its "agony". (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Urban rumor and traffic on the bridge of Recouvrance from the Tanguy tower. Around 6:30. Starting the diesel engine from a Transrade shuttle from the Arsenal (personnel transport). Echoes on the façades and walls of the Penfeld. Seagulls. The only motor heard symbolizes the decline of fishing and the industry of the sea in the harbor. It is opposed to the "fleet which sails in the morning" from ports like Concarneau or Douarnenez. The port of Brest does not have the sound activity that one would be entitled to expect (and hear). (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Rumor of the center of Antwerp from Linkeroever (left bank of the river). In front of Steenplein. Wind in the rushes and grass. Waves and ripples. Birds. Clacking and squeaking of a pontoon against a pile. Carillon of the cathedral on the right bank. Passage of an airplane. It should be noted that. For Antwerp, a provisional lookout was built on the town at the very place where the sound was taken. Nature and the city are not returned back-to-back by the listener; They complement each other. We are in a place of tranquility and rest. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Afternoon snatch in the local located on the moll dels Pescadors. Exchanges between the crier. Fishermen and fishmongers (men and women). Small dispute between fishmonger for the obtaining of a lot. Sneeze. Shocks of crates and ice in the background. Reverberation. It is the vocal matter that is the subject of the most numerous comments. The speed of enumeration of the crier fascinates. Verbal exchanges in Catalan are intelligible. But their meaning remains hermetic (less than the language of the dockers). For some listeners. The auction is a "show". Both for tourists and for locals. The "actors" of the auction are the current representatives of a somewhat "primitive" world where communication makes use of mysterious codes. Negotiations are "picaresque" between people who know each other well; Their special status gives them a certain serenity. And they know how to relax amicably ephemeral conflicts. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Sunday morning at Portal de la Pau. Between the Customs and the headquarters of the Autonomous Port of Barcelona. For the preparation of a race of rowing boats and the evening party. Traveling to the brass band. Installed on a stage. Which plays a paso doble. Echos simple and multiple caused by the facades of the two buildings and variations of timbres caused by wind and obstacles. Exchanges between adults. Between children and adults. We balance the sound system. Petarades. Engines of Golondrinas. The interviewees highlight the surprising absence of Catalan language. Some hear discussions in Castilian. Sometimes marked by a strong South American accent. The respondents discuss the danger of the loss of certain local values ??(Catalan language, sardana, etc.) and resistance to acculturation (Castilian language, paso doble, etc.). A resistance which of course has a political resonance in Barcelona. Feeling excluded. The Catalan is in a position of voyeur sonore. Of "auditor". So suddenly. The whole sequence is devalued. And the orchestra becomes that of a nerdy circus for tourists. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Sunday morning at Steenplein. Waiting and first notes of the orchestra installed under the kiosk (temporarily) at the castle of Steen. Sounds close to the start of a light vehicle. Voices and no women and children. Passages of motor boats on the Scheldt (left) and traffic sounds on E.Van Dijkkaai (right). Birds in the trees. The fragment gives an idyllic image of a quiet and cheerful place. Suitable for relaxation and leisure. When traffic from Plantinkaai is reduced. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Siren of fog of Port Autònom (at the end of the Nou contradic). Recorded since the dic of the east by great weather and great wind. Whistle blows from a cargo ship coming out of the port and slamming the semi-dejected sails from a sailboat that comes in. Machines of a remote cement plant. The listener attends the spectacle of the very essence of an ideal harbor. From a virtual belsuonare. The sirens evoke either the regulation of dangers. The accident that may or may have occurred. is,

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Waiting for the red light. Then starting and passing several trucks with trailers or semi-trailers and light vehicles on a paved roadway (Plantinkaai). Engine sounds. Clacking of trailers. Rolling sounds of light vehicles. Crunching of tires. Braking whistle. Voice. Step and cough at the beginning of the sequence. This sequence was recorded a few days before the prohibition for heavy goods vehicles to borrow the urban docks (September 1992). (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: The sequence is recorded on the moll walk of Bosh i Alsina. Close to a hopper overlooking the cinturó del Litoral. Rumble of traffic on the fast lane and more discreet drone of engines of boats in the dàrsena Nacional. Of the Golondrinas going to the jetty. We hear the steps in the gravel. Voices and cries of children and adults. As well as a whistled call. A mother fucks her little girl who is too close to an unprotected hopper. The listeners are almost all disappointed. Even very critical. About the flows of traffic flowing through the 14 lanes of the Moll de la Fusta. Underground or above ground. Local or motorways. The image of a cut between the city and the port embodied by a wall of noise is latent or expressed in most listeners. However. If one moves away from this area close to the road network. Where are installed benches and terraces of the restaurants. The space seems more pleasant. It attracts walkers of all kinds. And not only those belonging to the Barcelona golondrinera (that of the people who practice the Golondrinas). (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Scene of daily hiring of the dockers in Estibarna premises (local equivalent of a BCMO). Near the moll dels Pescadors. First of all, there is the terrace which extends the room. Then go down the stairs in the open air. Announcements and calls by the sound of the dockers hired by the number assigned to them (female voice in the foreground, male voice in 2nd). Professional discussions between dockworkers. A cat meow. Jostled by a docker (or the meow is imitated). Clicks. A scene that evokes the difficulty of dockworkers and precarious employment in their profession. (Abstract of author)

column8: Local dockers hiring on the Kattendijkdok (KOT). Professional discussions in a very reverberant environment while awaiting the drivers. A day when we know that there will be few elected officials. Calls and bursts of laughter across the room. (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Quai de la Dàrsena Sud in the Port Autònom. Maneuvering signals and motors for cranes and container handling equipment. Metal shocks. Reverberation caused by the ship's hull at dock and containers. Attention is mainly captured by the many engines. Their movements. And especially the rings that rhythm the sequence. In the activities heard. Use of "ultramodern" materials and techniques. Trucks represent the acoustic link that connects the powerful PAB to Europe and the world. The absence of violent metallic shocks highlights the professional qualities of the actors. Especially those of the crane operator. "A great professional". " a wonder ". (Abstract of author)

column5: Bardyn Jean-Luc (dir. et preneur de son)
column8: Handling with Klark in a PAB hangar on the Adossat moll. Sounds of the engines and metal clicks of the machines as they pass over the irregularities of the floor covering. The multiple events of this chaotic sequence form a fluid material that evokes the continuous loading of bulk goods. We're in a frigid world. Misty and dusty. The fragment evokes an industrial no man's land. A wasteland that. In a contradictory manner. Would be the place of intense activity. One often thinks of the activity of the textile factories of the Barcelona region. And more broadly. To the polluting and inhuman industry of the past. (Abstract of author)

column8: At the terrace of a cafe on the Quai de la Douane. Professional exchanges between traders at the neighboring table. Installing clients to another table. Indoor activity of the bar. Music of Balavoine. Passage on the dock of light vehicles and trucks. Horn blows. Starting a tug in the 3rd basin. One very positively comments on the conviviality that one can meet in the bars of a port. Day or night. These bars are the places where the Brestois. Traditionally "chauvinistic". But also curious. Will easily make magical encounters with extraordinary people. (Abstract of author)

column8: The Atlantic Garden was built on the slab that now covers the docks. Amazing sound effects can be spotted, whether they stay or move. The slab does not reach the facades of the buildings which dominate it, many hoppers covered by a grid or a metallo-textile structure let pass, or even locally, the railway sounds of Montparnasse 1 (transverse wharf and platforms ) And the activity of the transverse hall of Montparnasse 2. New activities are now perceptible on the slab: tennis courts, kindergartens, waterfalls .... The sound background remains, more or less discreet according to the schedules, the activity of the station. This is a paradigm of what might be the surroundings of the urban stations of tomorrow, for which coverage projects are sometimes proposed. (Abstract of author)

column8: Network of semi-covered galleries of the School of Decorative Arts of Nice. Buildings with exterior walls strewn with pebbles. The principle of building is to form differentiated layers: accessible terraces on the top looking at the city, tight network of circulation between the rooms located beneath these terraces. Some passages are narrow and skylights illuminate them creating links between layers. The footsteps and the voices inhabit these resonant places without the knowledge of where they come from, from the inside or from the outside. (Abstract of author)

column8: Recording from the sheltered seating of the Pont du Gard Museum. These concrete niches of parallelepiped shape are decorated with a bench forming part of the wall of the bottom and serving as a seat. They are aligned along the front of the public. These embedded foundations form both a observation post and an observable point. Their configuration favors the resonance of the voices, which clearly distinguishes them from the forecourt that they look at, while remaining phonically attached to them (author's abstract)

column2: Philippe ; Thomas,  Bardyn,  Rachel ; Rémy,  juL (Preneurs de son) ; Liveneau,  Jean-Luc ; McOisans,  Nicolas (Collaborateurs)
column8: The Pavilion of Universal Exhibition 1998 (Alvaro Siza) is a large stone box made up of 8 niches of about 4 m in depth and width and about fifteen meters in height, some of which are pierced from an opening towards the part Sail of the pavilion. Each niche is lined with very reflective ceramics (azuleijos) creating a resonance box. A simple clap of the hands reverberates in several echoes on the 5 walls (echo floating). Oriented towards the wide (south-west) this device opens at the same time to the winds and the sun. The veil on the other hand creates a cooler atmosphere: ideal conditions to generate a venturi effect. In this particular case the whole building seems to be conceived as a gigantic harp wind to make the wind sing as it passes through a set of acoustic filtering (size of the niches)

column8: The footbridge passes over the Canal Saint-Martin (Paris) and connects the two quays circulated in different directions. A first flight of stairs allows to reach a flat part and then a second one allows to go down on the other bank. A spatial tilting of the sound is sensitive: either it is linked to the progress of the pedestrian, which moves away from one source and approaches another, or it is linked to the alternations of the flows of circulation on one side and the other. column2: juL (Preneurs de son) ; Liveneau,  Bardyn,  Nicolas (Collaborateurs),  Philippe ; Thomas,  Rachel ; Rémy,  Jean-Luc ; McOisans
column8: The passage from the forecourt of Montparnasse station to the entrance hall (side Porte Océane) illustrates the phenomenon of delayed transition. The path articulates an open space to a very reverberant space through a sliding door in a glass wall. But there is no effect of cut. The sensitive form of this transition is characterized by the ambiguity of perception: one feels that the space is changing (and the visual and motor characteristics are important at this level) but the sound clues are still there as much as possible Wonders if we really have changed space. C is the opposition between effects related to the change of space (dilation, shrinkage) and effects related to the previous space (emergence, filtering, decrescendo) which form the experience of this transition.

column2: juL (Preneurs de son) ; Liveneau,  Rachel ; Rémy,  Bardyn,  Nicolas (Collaborateurs),  Philippe ; Thomas,  Jean-Luc ; McOisans
column8: In the shopping center of the Forum des Halles, this duct runs from "Rue Basse" to "Place Carrée", it is particularly contrasted. The passage between the two underground worlds is made by a threshold materialized by a lock consisting of double glass doors remaining open most of the time. The Rue Basse is compressive, because of these dimensions and also because of the frequentation sometimes close to saturation. The phenomenon of confusion is amplified. The passage from the Rue Basse to the Place Carrée is marked by an abrupt sounding dilation and a luminous lightening. The main connotations of the Place Carrée are those of the train station, the cathedral. The reverberation accentuates the feeling of emptiness, the impression of having a space suddenly cleared there conjugates. But it is difficult to say where the noises that are heard (ubiquity) come from.

column8: At the end of the Ile de la Cité in Paris is the Memorial of the Martyrs of the Deportation. The route begins with a small protected natural area and then descends through a narrow staircase up to the level of the Seine (20 steps) and arrives in a closed and reverberant space. This space gives access to the entrance of the monument. The concrete walls and the tiled floor combine minerality and reverberation. This fragment differs from the & quot; Forced Conduct 1 & quot; By the sounds of a construction site that accompanies the descent of the stairs.

column8: In this fragment, a mason tries to transmit information to another. It's done with & quot; The sound of his productive activity rather than stopping to communicate more easily. Here another worker in the vicinity knocks loudly with a hammer. The voice is therefore partially masked by the blows that fall at the same moment (author's abstract)

column8: This fragment is interesting on two levels. It stages a third worker who ensures the relay between the masons working with the crane and the crane operator. On the other hand, the important distance between the third worker and the crane operator as well as the very strong reverberation of the voice strongly mark the context of communication. (Abstract of author)

column8: Taking its Avenue Alsace-Lorraine. Bordered by buildings of the Haussmannian type, it is a fairly commercial avenue (exceptional shops: travel agencies, electronics ...) with large sidewalks planted with trees. Completely transformed in 1986 on the occasion of the arrival of the 1st Tramway line, the avenue has a pedestrian area and specific street furniture (benches, floor covering, grate around trees, fountains). ,

column8: This excerpt taken between 18h and 19h at the end of September illustrates the communication in a dense urban sound environment at this time of the day. The Place Victor Hugo (Grenoble) is square (115 m side) circumscribed by roads on its periphery (road and tram) and occupied in its center by a garden, a basin and a fountain. The buildings that form it, Haussmann style date from the late 19th century, they are occupied on the ground floor by shops, banks and a few cafes. The background of circulation is very present (especially at the beginning of the fragment) some voices are detached. This square is appreciated and very frequented despite traffic. (Abstract of author),

column8: The fruit and vegetable market from Oerlikon, a Wednesday morning around 9 o'clock. On this vast square, surrounded by buildings, dominate and alternate the voices of the merchants who praise their products or keep up with their customers. Some noises of money tinkling or crates. Footsteps. We sometimes understand snatches of conversation - phatic part of a commercial and friendly language. The urban drone, behind, is discreet and not very noticeable.

column8: The sound recording, realized on a Tuesday evening around 10 pm, gives an account of the sound environment of a district "hot" well known. The sound is dynamic. There is an alley that leads from a restaurant to a bar and a music cellar. One lets oneself be led, as it were, from one place to the other. We can then perceive, in addition to different musical rhythms, the strong animation of the neighborhood, made up of splinters of music, bursts of voices, and especially foreign voices that speak among themselves.

column8: Dynamic sound recording performed on Tuesday at 5:30 pm in one of the most famous streets in the world. A sax with kara oké opens the sequence on a background of carillon and animated rumor. This & quot; duo & quot; S & apos; fade to gradually let out the sound background of step and voice. One or two voices of passers-by emerge more distinctly. A tramway is cut in a trench. Then re-emerges the metabolic background of step, voice and currency. A second tram interrupts the acoustic climate again, albeit with a lower intensity. A voice very close to the microphone at the end of the sequence.

column8: The sequence was recorded on Tuesday at 16:30 in a small square in the pedestrian area of the city center behind the Niederdorf. A fountain may be heard continuously on a dull rumor, with some very feeble voices; Some private sounds are audible from the public space, a door that closes; Perhaps a very vague bell-tower, women's voices, then footsteps in a staircase-the whole not very distinct. The sequence ends on a few dull noises.

column8: A wooden footbridge along a canal on the route of the ancient fortifications. 12.45. On one side, trees and embankments planted, and, on the other, a set of houses. On a sonorous background of flowing water and the whistling of birds, footsteps, a passer-by who whispers the song and whistles, and other steps that sound very distinctly on a wooden covering, a few whistled calls and Women's voices.

column8: Waterfront, separated by a sidewalk 5 meters wide from road traffic. Raised in relation to the water (1 meter). The water is not very present.

column8: Raised church (and cloister of the Franciscans), which overlooks the city and the lake. Tourist attraction. Parvis in terrace opening on the dominated landscape and side gallery where the sound was taken. The deep and distant rumor of the city is superimposed and subtly mingled with the music of the organ of the church (wedding mass). One can also distinguish, punctually or intermittently, a building site noise, a motorcycle that starts, the discrete song of birds.

column8: Traditional religious ceremony which takes place once a year in the chapel of Plonivel: feast of the patron saint of the commune Saint-Brieu. In the entrance porch, two volunteers welcome participants and distribute the program. Repetition and sequence of "hello - hello". One is at the same time in a narrow space that allows the voices to be clearly audible, in spite of their entanglement, and already plunged in the interior atmosphere of the chapel where the organ improvises. The volunteers evoke the opera of the day before that took place in the same chapel and the route of the procession that follows the ceremony. Exchanges with investigators where the context of the & quot; Lesconil & quot; Is explained to the respondents.

column8: The Valparaiso is a small trawler returning from the sea, being unloaded in the port of Guilvinec. The captain invites us to have a coffee while telling the conditions of life on board. The exchanges between the investigator and the captain are simultaneously translated into English for the Finnish research partner. He evokes his working conditions: the rhythm of sleep on board, all the tasks on board (cleaning, maintenance of the boat, isolation from friends and family ...)

column8: Recording of one of the 3 torrent rivers that runs through the village, by a young sound artist from the Pistoletto Foundation. column8: Long waiting at the outlet of the railway tunnel of the passage of a TGV. From the gallery comes a kind of serious and regular roar, like the bumblebee of a big ventilation but strangely rhythmic like a slow breathing. Finally comes the train with its siren and staccato passage, upsetting the atmosphere for a few seconds, then return to calm. Note one comment from one of the partners: "You have to be a bit crazy or" soundscaper " To wait thus the only TGV which does not stop ... & quot;

column8: Check-in by car through the village. Illustration of a nesting nest of sound dimensions: The cockpit acts as an extreme cut or filter against external sounds, creating a clean space dominated by motor and driving sounds; On top of it, the car radio adds a sound dimension both abstract (the sounds of each radio show or the song) and concrete (how they are heard in the cockpit). At a still higher level, the selected radio station broadcasts a song that itself is a remix of world-famous music.

The majority of the sounds resonate slightly.

This large terrace is protected from the jetty by its high position and oriented at the same time on the sounds of the garden and the canal. Mainly characterized by aerial sounds, listening quickly projects us to the distant via the various urban sounds that penetrate the island. By listening, one hears some domestic emergencies coming to couple with the sound atmosphere of the city and that of the boats passing by waves.

column8: Large protruding balcony spanning about 20 m x 2m separated into compartment by glass dividers, R 5, about 16m from the street. The very exposed balcony creates a projection towards the outside landscape of the district, but also the adjacent marine landscape. The sound space completely reflects this very elevated position, almost at 360 degrees. A very landscaped acoustic universe that offers many distant sounds through distant sounds, down to the old town of Stockholm. We then distinguish some even more distant emergences that arrive from the city and thus finish to construct the sound landscape in response to the few sounds of proximity.

column8: Small balcony strongly recessed in R 2. The circulation in the central street of the district, in which emerges the local thermal bus, is quite present. Local sounds include the Latour terrace, one of the main cafés in the neighborhood. Children run across the street and a blackbird sings discreetly. In the apartment, the atmosphere is vocal and laughable: the investigator is heard exchanging with the inhabitant of the place. The sounds produced on the balcony itself evoke its small scale and rather protective incidence.

column2: Bardyn Jean-Luc. Marchal Théo (Preneur de son)
column8: Loggia narrow adjustable glass, R 4. Mounting of 4 sound fragments giving to hear sound environment open windows, then progressively more and more closed. First fragment open window. The car sounds, especially those of urban thermal buses (Villavesas), dominate without erasing a series of small sounds more discreet: a small carillon coming from a neighboring loggia, birds in the trees, passing children in the street. A vehicle slips like a diurnal rodeo, another horn, revealing the reverberation of the neighborhood. Quiet moments bring the distances of the ring road. In the following fragments, the progressive closing of the windows filters out the external sounds. The conversation in the kitchen begins to emerge as well as the micro-local sounds, the slippery steps, the movements of everyday life, in the loggia. Closed windows, traffic sounds are considerably weakened and now let the conversation filter out of the kitchen.
column9: Recording Type: Dynamic

column8: Uncovered terrace of a triplex at R 3. It is noon at the bell tower. The ring road is not far to the right. Some vehicles pass at the foot of the building, a remote urban bus. The avifauna is numerous in the young trees and in the wasteland. The inhabitant and the investigator enter the terrace. Children play on the neighboring terraces. A car is parked, its doors slam. column2: Bardyn Jean-Luc. Marchal Théo (Preneur de son)
column8: Balcony-loggia with R 2 glazed on 2 sides, with 4 sliding panels that allow to open more or less the space. Assembly of 3 fragments: In the first, sliding and open kitchen, there is a co-presence between the top and the bottom, inside and outside. We hear the investigator and the investigator exchange about the uses of the balcony. At the outside, below, a mother plays with her child and their cries reverberate. The circulation appears in very short puffs. The sounds of a building site, a few shutters that come alive complete the scene. In the second fragment the kitchen is closed and the sliding doors half open. The conversation in the kitchen gets very filtered and deafened. Emerge the sounds of the building and the courtyard with its own reverberation, solo birds in the local trees. In the third fragment, sliding and kitchen closed, we hear only the very filtered conversation of the kitchen, the exterior being almost totally erased, apart from the rolling of some vehicles and some calls in the courtyard.

column2: Bardyn Jean-Luc. Marchal Théo (Preneur de son)
column8: Balcony-loggia with R 3 glazed on 2 sides, with 4 sliding panels that allow to open more or less the space. Sliding open, we see a group of children in the yard and their echoes on the facades, listening and singing a piece of music of the moment ( "# 8201; El Taxi & # 8220; Pitbull, 2015) on a mobile phone. In the distance the sounds of a construction site, the presence of birds and urban traffic. A conversation inside is barely perceptible until you close the slide. It emerges then more clearly but filtered by the sound of the device itself, while the external sounds almost disappear. FX echo - cut - filtering.

column8: Long balcony in R 2 at 6.60 m of the street, directed on an inner court almost closed by buildings, strongly connected to the habitat. A background of calm enveloping and reverberant that makes the voices very clear: cries of children playing in the yard on a wooden and gravel floor, little traffic noise, a distant conversation between men in the adjacent streets. A strong presence of the birds and the vegetation that the wind makes rustle, with some emergences of the domestic sounds coming from the housing all around. An enveloping and protective atmosphere combining density and safety.

column8: Balcony protected by the upper balcony, R 3. Warm summer evening. Urban rumor stable. From the balconies, terraces and in the adjoining rooms, with family and friends, we watch the end of the match between Germany and Ghana at the 2014 World Cup. When a goal is scored, the fans of Ghana and Dog of a household: percussion in some, Wagnerian trumpet in the others, firing fire in the distance have repercussions in the space, groups pass by chanting their enthusiasm and animated discussions emerge. Several vehicles pass on the street. Then the explosions of the party begin in the distant downtown.

column8: Shining balcony covered by that of the upper floor recess in loggia in R 4. The urban drone is moderate and stable in the center of the scene. The avifauna is unleashed in the vegetable. Some children practice basketball under the Panzerhalle. An urban bus runs north to the right, another to the west. The investigator and the resident discuss on the lower, protruding balcony. Preparations for the family dinner, the canopy is put on the metal table of the balcony by the big son. Transmission wooded steps on the slats, crunches. It circulates in the duplex, when one of the members of the family comes in, the metal door slams. Inside and outside are confused.

column8: Covered throughout its length which serves 5-6 dwellings in R 4. All the urban life penetrates by the great gap north of the island on the left; It forms a U facing south, but with a wide opening to the north which takes away a lot of privacy in our garden: trucks on the fast lane, local traffic with the city bus, basketball under the Panzerhalle behind the building, arrival Children, passing a propeller plane. The avifauna is located at a certain distance, especially on the hill near the Wagenburg in the south. Many events at this time in the dwellings that surround us. The scene appears schizophonic, with left circulation and "nature" potentially available right.

column2: Houdemont Karine (Enquêteur), Atienza Badel Ricardo (Compositeur),  Lounis Nicolas (Compositeur),  McOisans juL (Compositeur)
column8: Recording movement of the installation in site, at a quiet time of the partition. At first, an extract of the first sequence (approach), filtered by the diffusion system, is recognized. Then, the diffused sounds mingle with the real sounds (voices, passages of vehicles on the wet pavement, train, plane ...) creating a mixing effect and ubiquity, and sometimes seem strangely dialogue with them: towards 2 Minutes, at the distant whistle of a train responds a siren blow (effect of enchainment), later, the passage of an airplane is integral to the rumble of the oven ...

column2: Atienza Badel Ricardo (Compositeur),  McOisans juL (Compositeur),  Lounis Nicolas (Compositeur),  Houdemont Karine (Enquêteur)
column8: A precautionary step that reveals soil textures; From the workshop where the machines stir, one passes in front of the boiler room where the low frequencies brought by the flames palpitate; In the distance on the road approaches the roar of two mopeds which crosses the passage of a train of merchandise; A cut-off effect marks the passage through the through room to the rear of the building; Little by little the songs of the crickets emerge. Of the birds, while the sound of the studio & amp; Furnaces are kept at a distance; The sequence ends with a hesitating blow of the siren, like the cry of a wounded whale, symbol of this factory at the abandonment ...

column8: At the back of the building, on a background of crickets, wind in the foliage & amp; From the palpitation of the heart of the fire, one hears the voice of M. Bergeron, colored by the system & amp; The diffusion space, explain the fusion of the brick; This voice itself seems to merge with the whole landscape & amp; Of the sound space.

column2: Lounis Nicolas (Compositeur),  McOisans juL (Compositeur), Atienza Badel Ricardo (Compositeur),  Houdemont Karine (Enquêteur)
column8: Succession of twice the same extract, the first coming directly from the sound & amp; The second recorded on the site where the sound is scattered in the space. The composition itself comes from an anecdote of M. Bergeron, who said that it was possible to recognize at the ear whether a brick or a tile was well-baked or not. In fact the sounds used are those of different tiles found on the spot. The musical aspect is a wake-up call to the question we often asked throughout the work & amp; To which we had to answer & quot; no, this is not music that will be diffused ... & quot; - whatever...
